class pysixdesk.lib.fort2_tools.Fort2Struct¶

Bases: object

Structure containing fort.2 information

createDrift(iSing=None, L=None, lDebug=True)¶

creates a new drift, ie the SINGLE ELEMENT and the BLOCk if iSing and iBlock are not None, an existing one is cloned

echoDimensions()¶

return dimensions of arrays (ie SINGLE ELEMENTs, BLOCs, LATTICE ELEMENTs)

getIBlock(tmpName, key='NAME', lDebug=True)¶

return index of BLOC named tmpName from list of BLOCks

getIDriftFromBlockName(tmpName, lDebug=True)¶

return index of drift in list of BLOCks and in list of SINGLE ELEMENTs

getISingEl(tmpName, lDebug=True)¶

return index of SINGLE ELEMENT named tmpName from list of SINGLE ELEMENTs

pysixdesk.lib.fort2_tools.fort2_to_twiss(struct)¶

Transforms fort.2 in a Twiss-like structure, including the extra field S

pysixdesk.lib.fort2_tools.read_fort2(file)¶
pysixdesk.lib.fort2_tools.twiss_to_fort2(sequence)¶

Transforms a twiss-like structure into fort.2. The twiss structure should contain the same fields as the output in fort2_to_twiss

pysixdesk.lib.fort2_tools.write_fort2(file, struct)¶

Writes the modified fort.2 file

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2 module¶

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.add_aperture(sequence, name, position, index, precision=0.0001)¶

Add aperture marker to fort.2 file sequence

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.aperture_type(name, aperture)¶

Transform BeamLossPattern aperture type into LIMI block aperture type

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.assign_apertures(F2sequence, TWstruct)¶

Assign apertures to fort.2 lenses, interpolated as done in BeamLossPattern

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.checkNameLengths(tmpSequence, tmpAperLimi, maxLen=16)¶
pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.clean_apertures(struct)¶

Clean apertures (take only non-zero apertures and remove redundant ones) I remove apertures if they only have drifts in between and the same aperture values, so I leave only the first and the last aperture, the middle one are redundant. Two are enough for a backtracking, if they only have drifts between them. Here we don’t need to include the offsets

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.merge_survey(TWstruct, SUstruct, SUregions)¶

Merge survey data with the aperture model: Assign an interpolate aperture to the survey points from the aperture model

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.read_survey(file1, dS=0.001)¶

Read Survey file dS=shift in s-coordinate [m] for inserting 0-offset elements before/after survey segment

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.rename_apertures(struct)¶

Rename apertures to reduce number of new single elements

pysixdesk.lib.generate_fort2.run(fc2, aperture, survery=None, ldebug=False, lold=False)¶

‘Controls sixtrack job execution.

sixtrack_prep_cfg(**kwargs)¶

Prepares sixtrack’s fort.3 config, by adding the length of the machine, read in the fort.3.aux file, and any extra kwargs.

Parameters:**kwargs – are added to the config.
Returns:fort.3 placeholder dictionnary with the added keys/values.
Return type:dict
sixtrack_prep_job(fort_cfg, source_prefix=None, output_file='fort.3')¶

Prepares sixtrack fort.3 file.

Parameters:
  • fort_cfg (dict) – dict containing the placeholder/value pairs.
  • source_prefix (str/path, optional) – if provided, will use the
  • folder prefix when looking for the fort_file and fc.3 (provided) –
  • files. –
  • output_file (str, optional) – name of the prepared fort.3 file.
sixtrack_run(output_file)¶

Runs sixtrack.

Parameters:output_file (str) – File in which to write sixtrack’s stdout.
sixtrack_temp_folder(folder='temp', symlink_parent=True, extra=[])¶

Helper context manager to deal with the temp folder and symlinking the input files. On release, moves back to the orignal folder and deletes the temp folder.

Parameters:
  • folder (str, optional) – name of temp folder.
  • symlink_parent (bool, optional) – controls whether to symlink input
  • and extra files from the parent dir to the temporary folder. (files) –
  • extra (list, optional) – list of extra files to symlink.
Raises:

FileNotFoundError – if input file not found during symlinking.
write_oneturnresult()¶

Writes the oneturnresult file.

Parameters:

  • output. –
Returns:

Print the status information of this study. job= 0: print madx, oneturn sixtrack job 1: print sixtrack job 2: print madx, oneturn sixtrack and sixtrack jobs where: the filter condition for database query, e.g. “status=’complete’”

prepare(task_ids, trans, exe, exe_args, input_path, output_path, flavour='tomorrow', *args, **kwargs)¶

Prepare the submission file.

Parameters:
  • task_ids (int) – The task ids for submission
  • trans (list) – The python modules needed by the executables
  • exe (str) – The executable
  • exe_args (str) – The additional arguments for executable except for
  • wu_id. –
  • input_path (str) – The folder with input files
  • output_path (str) – The output folder
  • flavour (str) – The queue types of HTCondor
remove(study_path, status, *args, **kwargs)¶

Cancel the submitted jobs :param studypath: The absolute path of the study :type studypath: string :param status: The job status. 0: unexpanded, 1:idle, 2:held, :type status: int :param 3: removed, 4:done, 5:held, 6:submission_err

submit(input_path, job_name, limit, trials=5, *args, **kwargs)¶

Submit the job to the cluster :param input_path: The input path to hold the input files :type input_path: string :param job_name: The job name (also is the batch_name for HTCondor) :type job_name: string :param limit: The maximum job number per submittion :type limit: int :param trials: The maximum number of resubmission when submit failed :type trials: int

pysixdesk.lib.utils.check(files)¶

Check the existence of the files and rename them if the files is a dict which looks like {‘file1_oldName’: ‘file1_newName’, ‘file2_oldName’: ‘file2_newName’}

pysixdesk.lib.utils.condor_logger(name)¶

Prepares a logger for job on HTCondor. It splits the levels to stdout and stderr, and disables module level logging.

DEBUG, INFO go to stdout WARNING, ERROR go to stderr

Parameters:name (str) – name of the logger.
pysixdesk.lib.utils.decompress_buf(buf, out, des='file')¶

Data decompression to retrieve from database

pysixdesk.lib.utils.diff(file1, file2, logger=None, **kwargs)¶

Displays the diff of two files.

Parameters:
  • file1 (str/path) – path to first file for the diff.
  • file2 (str/path) – path to second file for the diff.
  • logger (logging.logger, optional) – logger with which to display the
  • if None, will use print. (diff,) –
  • kwargs – additional arguments for difflib.unified_diff.
pysixdesk.lib.utils.download_output(filenames, dest, zp=True)¶

Download the requested files to the given destinaion. If zp is true, then zip the files before download.

pysixdesk.lib.utils.exc_catch(fun, exc_action=None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Wrapper which catches errors of provided function “fun” and runs “exc_action” if provided.

Parameters:
  • fun (callable) – The wrapped function.
  • exc_action (callable, optionnal) – callable which will run if “fun”
  • an Exception. If None will not do anything, the Exception will (raises) –
  • supressed. (be) –
  • kwargs (args) – passed on to the wrapped function call.
Returns:

The output of the wrapped function if no exceptions are raised, the output of the “action” callable if provided and an Exception is raised.
pysixdesk.lib.utils.replace(patterns, replacements, source, dest)¶

Reads a source file and writes the destination file. In each line, replaces patterns with replacements.

class for handling workspaces.

./sandbox/
|_ studies/
|_ test/
|_ study_000/
|_ study_001/
|_ study_002/
|_ templates/
|_ htcondor_run.sub
|_ hl10.mask
|_ fort.3.mother2
|_ fort.3.mother1
|_ config.py
